name: Global Network of Civil Society Organisations for Disaster Reduction
goal:
GNDR is a network of Civil Society Organisations from the across the world with the aim of helping local communities build resilience against disaster, whether it would be natural or man-made, along with implementing practices that lower disaster risk. Local non-governmental organisations can join GNDR and become a member. GNDR membership provides opportunities for these local civil society organisations to get involved and be updated regularly with progress in each region.

GNDR has been involved in several projects over the years including Views from the Frontline (VFL) funded by the European Commission - DEVCO. The VFL 2019 programme aims to strengthen the inclusion and systematic collaboration between governments, at-risk people and civil society in the design and implementation of DRR and resilience policies and practices.

The specific objectives are:
1. To establish a citizen-based process to measure local progress in inclusive risk governance
2. To strengthen in-country civil society monitoring, DRR and advocacy capacities
3. To support establishment of local-level baselines and generate local risk information to inform policy and local plans.

The vision of GNDR is to create a vibrant, active, collaborative civil society that supports people and their communities to prepare for, mitigate, respond to and recover from disaster and adapt to hazards and a changing climate. GNDR are committed to work together in a collaborative, inclusive and participatory way in addition to sharing and learning from different experiences to further understand how local actors can act in the best interests of the community.

GNDR achieves this by having a well structured governance system that allows close interaction with members, the GNDR secretariat and regionally-represented Global Board.
